com.salesforce.omakase.broadcast

Class QueuingBroadcaster

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.salesforce.omakase.broadcast.AbstractBroadcaster
      • com.salesforce.omakase.broadcast.QueuingBroadcaster
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Broadcaster

    public final class QueuingBroadcaster
extends AbstractBroadcaster
    A broadcaster that queues broadcasts.

    Broadcasts can be paused with pause() and resumed with resume(). The queue operates on a FIFO basis.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class com.salesforce.omakase.broadcast.AbstractBroadcaster

    • Constructor Detail

      • QueuingBroadcaster

        public QueuingBroadcaster(Broadcaster broadcaster)
        Creates a new QueuingBroadcaster and calls AbstractBroadcaster.chain(Broadcaster) on this instance, passing in the given Broadcaster.
        Parameters:
        broadcaster - Add this broadcaster to the end of the chain. This will receive all broadcasts when the queue is not paused or when it resumes.

    • Method Detail

      • broadcast

        public void broadcast(Broadcastable broadcastable)
        Description copied from interface: Broadcaster
        Broadcasts the given event (syntax unit).
        Parameters:
        broadcastable - The Broadcastable syntax unit.

      • pause

        public QueuingBroadcaster pause()
        Pauses the queue. While pause, all broadcasts will be stored and will not be relayed until resume() is called.
        Returns:
        this, for chaining.

      • resume

        public QueuingBroadcaster resume()
        Resumes broadcasts. Any broadcasts currently in the queue will be immediately sent out.
        Returns:
        this, for chaining.

      • size

        public int size()
        Gets the count of the items currently in the queue.
        Returns:
        Number of items in the queue.

      • peek

        public Broadcastable peek()
        Retrieves, but does not remove the first item in the queue.
        Returns:
        The first item in the queue.

      • peekLast

        public Broadcastable peekLast()
        Retrieves, but does not remove the last item in the queue.
        Returns:
        The last item in the queue.

      • all

        public Iterable<Broadcastable> all()
        Gets a a view of all items in the queue.
        Returns:
        All units in the queue.

      • reject

        public QueuingBroadcaster reject(Broadcastable broadcastable)
        Prevents the given Broadcastable unit, if it currently exists in the queue, from being broadcasted once resume() is called.
        Parameters:
        broadcastable - The Broadcastable unit to reject.
        Returns:
        this, for chaining.
